Description: Asymmetrical bronze axe-head: with an inclined butt and concave sides. The lower shorter side can be seen to be markedly more concave than the upper side and the cutting end to be lop-sided or skewed. The lugs are thin and angular. The piece is thickly corroded. Considerable traces of textile survive in he corrosion product and particles of sand and other matter adhere to it.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: T. E. Peet & W. L S. Loat, ‘The Cemeteries of Abydos, part III. 1912-13 (London, 1913), 32, pl. X, 2; E. Kühnert-Eggesbrecht, ‘Die Axt als Waffe und Werkzeug im alten Ägypten’ (Berlin, 1969), 111, G-IX/1.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (157)
